flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: VD - Vitamin D. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Also known as slow-twitch fibers, have high myoglobin content and primarily derive their energy aerobically.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: RF - Red fibers. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Have high myoglobin content and primarily derive their energy aerobically.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: SF - slow-twitch fibers. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Made of actin along with two other proteins: troponin and tropomyosin.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: TF - thin filaments. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Myofibrils are surrounded by a covering known as the sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR), a modified endoplasmic reticulum that contains a high concentration of Ca2+ ions.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: SR - sarcoplasmic reticulum. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Created by transferring a phosphate group from ATP to creatine during times of rest.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: CP - Creatine phosphate. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Whereas the thin filaments are made of actin along with two other proteins: troponin and tropomyosin.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'myo' = muscle. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: The thick filaments are organized bundles of myosin, whereas the thin filaments are made of actin along with two other proteins: troponin and tropomyosin.
flashcards.mnemonic: Key concepts: filaments, organized, bundles. Link these to 'troponin'.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Acetylcholine is degraded in the synapse by the enzyme known as acetylcholinesterase.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'ase' = enzyme. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Bones in the appendicular skeleton are typically long bones, which are characterized by cylindrical shafts called diaphyses that swell at each end to form metaphyses, and that terminate in epiphyses.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'di' = two. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: The inorganic components include calcium, phosphate, and hydroxide ions, which harden together to form hydroxyapatite crystals (Ca10(PO4)6(OH)2).
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'hydro' = water. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Also known as fast-twitch fibers, contain much less myoglobin.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: WF - White fibers. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Connections between the cytoplasm of adjacent cells, allowing for the flow of ions directly between cells.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: GJ - gap junctions. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Time between reaching threshold and the onset of contraction.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: LP - latent period. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: This is known as frequency summation, as shown in Figure 11.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: FS - frequency summation. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: The skull, vertebral column, rib cage, and hyoid bone (a small bone in the anterior neck used for swallowing); it provides the basic central framework for the body.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: AS - axial skeleton. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Filled with hematopoietic stem cells, which are responsible for the generation of all the cells in our blood; yellow marrow is composed primarily of fat and is relatively inactive.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: RM - Red marrow. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: While transverse channels (those with an axis perpendicular to the bone) are known as Volkmann’s canals.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: HC - Haversian canals. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Longitudinal channels (those with an axis parallel to the bone) are known as Haversian canals, while transverse channels (those with an axis perpendicular to the bone) are known as Volkmann’s canals.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: VC - Volkmann’s canals. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Often, our muscles work in antagonistic pairs; one relaxes while the other contracts.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: AP - antagonistic pairs. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Larger-scale mutations in which large segments of DNA are affected, as demonstrated in Figure 12.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'soma' = body; 'chrom' = color. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: In an autosomal dominant pattern of inheritance, the trait is encoded by a dominant gene on an autosomal chromosome.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'soma' = body; 'auto' = self. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: But disproportionately affect males who have only one X chromosome.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'soma' = body; 'auto' = self. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Usually resulting in either changes in the amino acid sequence or premature truncation of the protein (due to the generation of a nonsense mutation).
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'di' = two. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Occur when a segment of DNA from one chromosome is swapped with a segment of DNA from another chromosome.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'trans' = across. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: This loss of genetic variation may cause reduced fitness of the population, a condition known as inbreeding depression.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'di' = two; 'pre' = before. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: We can extend a Punnett square to account for the inheritance of two different genes using a dihybrid cross.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'di' = two. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Adaptive pressure can lead to the emergence and dominance of an initially extreme phenotype through directional selection.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'di' = two. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Facilitated by the existence of polymorphisms—naturally occurring differences in form between members of the same population, such as light and dark coloration in the same species of butterfly.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'di' = two. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: A monohybrid cross accounts for one gene; a dihybrid cross accounts for two genes.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'mono' = one/single. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Disruptive selection is facilitated by the existence of polymorphisms—naturally occurring differences in form between members of the same population, such as light and dark coloration in the same species of butterfly.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'poly' = many. Remember what these roots mean!

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Individuals with more than 40 sequence repeats have full penetrance—100 percent of individuals with this allele show symptoms of Huntington’s disease.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: FP - full penetrance. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: All of the alleles that exist within a species are known as the gene pool.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: GP - gene pool. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Occur when one nucleotide in DNA (A, C, T, or G) is swapped for another.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: PM - Point mutations. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Occur when the change in nucleotide has no effect on the final protein synthesized from the gene.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: SM - Silent mutations. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Occur when the change in nucleotide results in substituting one amino acid for another in the final protein.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: MM - Missense mutations. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Occur when the change in nucleotide results in substituting a stop codon for an amino acid in the final protein.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: NM - Nonsense mutations. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Nonsense mutations occur when the change in nucleotide results in substituting a stop codon for an amino acid in the final protein.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: SC - stop codon. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Occur when nucleotides are inserted into or deleted from the genome.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: FM - Frameshift mutations. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: These can be subcategorized as insertion or deletion mutations.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: DM - deletion mutations. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Occur when a segment of DNA is copied multiple times in the genome.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: DM - Duplication mutations. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Occur when a segment of DNA is reversed within the chromosome.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: IM - Inversion mutations. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: One important class of deleterious mutations is known as inborn errors of metabolism.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: IEOM - inborn errors of metabolism. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Changes in the composition of the gene pool due to chance.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: GD - Genetic drift. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: More extreme case of genetic drift in which a small population of a species finds itself in reproductive isolation from other populations as a result of natural barriers, catastrophic events, or other bottlenecks that drastically and suddenly reduce the size of the population available for breeding.
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: FE - founder effect. Associate each letter with the word.
